CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 11, 1950, pg. 1, reads: "SELF-DEFENSE OR WITH INTENT? - A jury of eight women and four men retired Thursday morning to determine which of these motives was in mind of Charles Burrell, 27 year-old former night club singer, when he stabbed Louis Jamieson, 38 year-old ex-convict to death last Sept. 8 in the home of Mrs. Lena Ellis, 1417 Pasture Way. Burrell, tabbed "pretty boy" by trial observers, is shown leaving Judge Russell H. Adams' courtroom in the custody of a deputy sheriff. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Deputy sheriff wearing plaid necktie and badge, handcuffed to Charles Burrell after his trial for stabbing Louis Jamieson in self-defense, in corridor of the Allegheny County Courthouse
